intro: Aeschynomene grandiflora, commonly known as the largeflower aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30 to 100 centimeters. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Aeschynomene grandiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
